intro: Alsinanthus echinatus, commonly known as the spiny alsin, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture. Alsinanthus echinatus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
